newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-CHAMPION MCCOY MAY MISS CHELTENHAM.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-CHAMPION MCCOY MAY MISS CHELTENHAM.

text.p: Tony McCoy, the British champion jump jockey, suffered a crashing fall on Thursday in a race at Wincanton and could be out of action for two months, forcing him to miss the big Cheltenham Festival in March.
McCoy was stretchered off the track and taken to a nearby hospital with a suspected broken shoulder after his mount fell in the second race.
Course doctor Chris Browne said: ''Tony McCoy has got a significant injury to his left shoulder. It is probably a break, but only the x-rays will determine the true extent of the damage.
''It is never good news with these sorts of injuries and in my experience he could be facing an enforced holiday of around two months. ''
McCoy, with 130 winners to his credit this season, is the runaway leader in the British jump jockeys' table.
Following a recent strengthening of a link-up with top trainer Martin Pipe, McCoy had been looking forward to some choice rides at Cheltenham.
